Your pronunciation of Voshod sounds more like the Russian words for "your cat" (ваш кот, vash kot) than the actual name of the spacecraft. The right pronunciation would be [Vos-hod], without the [sh] sound, but with [s] and [h] separately.
no sound

I don't remember exact date, but I was one of your earliest Patreon supporters. It was the first time I had have seen discord and that first time you asked for help with a script, I did my best. Over the years I have faded back and let the young'ens take over. This really is more their skill set any way. I knew from the beginning you were the right guy for this job. And I wanted to do what I could to help in that success.

Just the other day I had to redirect my Patreon plumbers elsewhere. I lose benefits July 1st. I'll miss being on the inside, but I'm not exactly going anywhere. I'm still a dedicated fan who watches all you do.

Finally, some old guy advice. I am a 3-time college drop-out myself. I finally decided to watch for when the timing was right for me to finish my degree. When the time came, I went back hard core and got my bachelor's in Engineering Technology. It worked this time because I had finally developed enough to handle college. I was eventually awarded Senior of the Year by Herff College of Engineering. I say this not to brag but to let you know that you don't have to give up on college altogether. Just watch for the right time to go back. Having seen your skills, I believe you have now developed what it would take to become a solid Engineer or Engineering Technologist. Having seen you passion and personality, I would recommend Engineering Tech. You would fit right in.

I be hanging around in case you need more advice. Most of my contact info is publicly available. Watching you still.

John C. Burr
A.K.A. Cogiflector

YouTube: "Something's Wrong, Nobody Gets Done"?!?

About The "J - K - L" Buttons?

"J - K - L" Keys (Three-Button Play) Shortcuts:

"L" ▶ - Plays Forward - Press Repeatedly To Shuttle Forward At 2, 3, 5, And 8 Times Normal Speed

"J" ◀ - Plays Backward - Press Repeatedly To Shuttle Backward At 2, 3, 5, And 8 Times Normal Speed

"K" ❚❚ - Pauses

"K" ❚❚ + Hold "L" ▶ - Plays Forward At 8 FPS (NTSC), 6 FPS (PAL)

"K" ❚❚ + Hold "J" ◀ - Plays Backward At 8 FPS (NTSC), 6 FPS (PAL)

"K" ❚❚ + Press "L" ▶ - Steps Forward 1 Frame At A Time

"K" ❚❚ + Press "J" ◀ - Steps Backward 1 Frame At A Time

you could save a ton of RCS fuel by managing your RCS ports. every RCS port needs to serve only one purpose.
go to the settings of each RCS port and disable the ones you do not want, as a general rule i use reaction wheels for attitude changes (at least when time is not an issue), and only use RCS for translation.

Tim your crafts have a tendency to oscillate with RCS burst in every direction (except prograde/retrograde) back and forth.
for docking you do not need a ton of RCS ports, only one in each direction close to the center of mass.
disable pitch yaw and roll on the docking ports and let your reaction wheels deal with that.
